## Public Member Functions

### initialize() {#a1f3d1dc8fc604a49c072019d874dd237}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AttributorAttributes.cpp&#125;::AAValueSimplifyArgument::initialize (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Initialize the state with the information in the Attributor <code>A</code>.

This function is called by the Attributor once all abstract attributes have been identified. It can and shall be used for task like:
<ul>
<li>identify existing knowledge in the IR and use it for the &quot;known state&quot;</li>
<li>perform any work that is not going to change over time, e.g., determine a subset of the IR, or attributes in-flight, that have to be looked at in the <code>updateImpl</code> method.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/attributorattributes-cpp/#l06351">6351</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/attributorattributes-cpp">AttributorAttributes.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
